Interface Category<O,M>

Type Parameters:
O - the type of objects
M - the type of morphisms
All Known Subinterfaces:
Preorder<E>
All Known Implementing Classes:
FiniteSetsCategory, HilbertSpacesCategory
public interface Category<O,M>
Represents a Category in category theory.

A category consists of:

  • A collection of objects (O).
  • A collection of morphisms (arrows) between objects (M).
  • A composition operation for morphisms.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    O
    codomain(M morphism)
    Returns the codomain (target) of a morphism.
    M
    compose(M f, M g)
    Composes two morphisms.
    O
    domain(M morphism)
    Returns the domain (source) of a morphism.
    Set<M>
    hom(O source, O target)
    Returns the hom-set between two objects (set of all morphisms from source to target).
    M
    identity(O object)
    Returns the identity morphism for a given object.

  • Method Details

    • identity

      M identity(O object)
      Returns the identity morphism for a given object.
      Parameters:
      object - the object
      Returns:
      the identity morphism 1_object

    • compose

      M compose(M f, M g)
      Composes two morphisms.

      compose(f, g) corresponds to f ∘ g (f after g).

      Parameters:
      f - the second morphism to apply
      g - the first morphism to apply
      Returns:
      f ∘ g
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the domain of f does not match the codomain of g

    • domain

      O domain(M morphism)
      Returns the domain (source) of a morphism.
      Parameters:
      morphism - the morphism
      Returns:
      the domain object

    • codomain

      O codomain(M morphism)
      Returns the codomain (target) of a morphism.
      Parameters:
      morphism - the morphism
      Returns:
      the codomain object

    • hom

      Set<M> hom(O source, O target)
      Returns the hom-set between two objects (set of all morphisms from source to target).
      Parameters:
      source - the source object
      target - the target object
      Returns:
      the set of morphisms Hom(source, target)
